question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Given Donald Trump is the Republican nominee, will he win the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means he is the official candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates or changes leading up to the election.

Then, will Donald Trump win the general election for President of the United States on November 5, 2024? The result is based on the official results certified by the relevant election authorities, and any disputes must be resolved in favor of the official count.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is the Republican nominee and wins the 2024 US Presidential Election, will he face legal challenges that impact his candidacy before the election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) he wins the general election for President of the United States on November 5, 2024, as the Republican nominee, determined by the official results certified by the relevant election authorities.

Then, will Donald Trump face any legal challenges that significantly impact his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election before November 5, 2024? Significant impact is defined as any legal action that results in: 1) a formal indictment, 2) a conviction, 3) a court ruling that restricts his ability to run for or hold office, or 4) a legal settlement that imposes conditions affecting his candidacy. The legal challenges must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to confirm the nature and impact of the challenges.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, wins the general election, and (b) faces legal challenges that impact his candidacy before the 2024 election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and wins the general election for President of the United States on November 5, 2024. The outcome must be determined by the official results certified by the relevant election authorities, and any allegations or disputes regarding the election results must be resolved in favor of the official count. If Donald Trump is not the Republican nominee at the time of the election, the question will resolve as No.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if, before November 5, 2024, Donald Trump faces any legal challenges that significantly impact his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election. Significant impact is defined as any legal action that results in: 1) a formal indictment, 2) a conviction, or 3) a court ruling that restricts his ability to run for or hold office, or 4) a legal settlement that imposes conditions affecting his candidacy. The legal challenges must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to confirm the nature and impact of the challenges.

question.title: Will a significant challenger emerge within the Republican Party before the 2024 primaries?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before February 1, 2024, a candidate emerges within the Republican Party who is widely recognized as a significant challenger to the incumbent or leading candidates for the Republican nomination for President. A 'significant challenger' is defined as a candidate who meets the following criteria: (1) They must have at least 10% support in national polls conducted by reputable polling organizations (such as Gallup, Quinnipiac, or FiveThirtyEight) at any point before the primaries; (2) They must have received endorsements from at least three prominent Republican figures or organizations; (3) They must have officially declared their candidacy and be actively campaigning. If a candidate drops out after gaining significant traction, this will not affect the resolution if they were considered a significant challenger prior to their withdrawal.

question.body:

(a) Before February 1, 2024, a candidate emerges within the Republican Party who is widely recognized as a significant challenger to the incumbent or leading candidates for the Republican nomination for President. A 'significant challenger' is defined as a candidate who meets the following criteria: (1) They must have at least 10% support in national polls conducted by reputable polling organizations (such as Gallup, Quinnipiac, or FiveThirtyEight) at any point before the primaries; (2) They must have received endorsements from at least three prominent Republican figures or organizations; (3) They must have officially declared their candidacy and be actively campaigning. If a candidate drops out after gaining significant traction, this will not affect the resolution if they were considered a significant challenger prior to their withdrawal.

(b) Before November 5, 2024, Donald Trump faces any legal challenges that significantly impact his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election. Significant impact is defined as any legal action that results in: 1) a formal indictment, 2) a conviction, or 3) a court ruling that restricts his ability to run for or hold office, or 4) a legal settlement that imposes conditions affecting his candidacy. The legal challenges must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to confirm the nature and impact of the challenges.

Then, will Donald Trump be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met:

A 'significant challenger' is defined as a candidate who meets the following criteria: (1) They must have at least 10% support in national polls conducted by reputable polling organizations (such as Gallup, Quinnipiac, or FiveThirtyEight) at any point before the primaries; (2) They must have received endorsements from at least three prominent Republican figures or organizations; (3) They must have officially declared their candidacy and be actively campaigning. question.title: If Donald Trump is the Republican nominee, will Republican voter turnout increase significantly in 2024 compared to 2020?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, will voter turnout among Republican voters in the 2024 election increase significantly compared to 2020?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves Yes if Donald Trump is the nominee selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if, by December 31, 2024, voter turnout among Republican voters in the 2024 United States presidential election is reported to be at least 5 percentage points higher than in the 2020 election, based on official certified election results and verified by reputable sources. Resolves No if the increase is less than 5 percentage points or if data is inconclusive.

question.title: Given Trump is the 2024 Republican nominee and GOP turnout increases, will he lead in 2024 polls?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (1) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) voter turnout among Republican voters in the 2024 election increases by at least 5 percentage points compared to 2020. Then, will Donald Trump lead in national polling averages against any potential Democratic candidate at any point during 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- Trump must be the Republican nominee, as determined by the Republican National Convention.
- Republican voter turnout must increase by at least 5 percentage points, based on official results and reputable reports.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Trump must lead in national polling averages against any Democratic candidate at any point in 2024.
- Polling data must come from at least three reputable organizations and show Trump with higher support than the Democratic candidate, based on a minimum of three polls conducted in 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and voter turnout among Republican voters increases significantly in the 2024 election compared to 2020, and (2) Donald Trump leads in national polls against potential Democratic candidates in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) By December 31, 2024, voter turnout among Republican voters in the 2024 United States presidential election is reported to be significantly higher than in the 2020 election. 'Significantly higher' is defined as an increase of at least 5 percentage points in the voter turnout rate among registered Republican voters, as reported by reputable sources such as the U.S. Census Bureau or major news organizations. The turnout rates must be based on official certified election results and may be verified through exit polls or voter surveys conducted by recognized research organizations. (3) At any point during the calendar year 2024, Donald Trump is leading in national polling averages against any potential Democratic candidate for the 2024 presidential election. The polling data must be sourced from at least three reputable polling organizations (such as Gallup, Quinnipiac, Ipsos, or FiveThirtyEight) and must be publicly available. The average must show Trump with a higher percentage of support than the Democratic candidate in question, based on a minimum of three polls conducted during the year. If any of these conditions are not met, this question will resolve as No.

question.body:

A 'significant challenger' is defined as a candidate who: (1) has at least 10% support in national polls conducted by reputable polling organizations at any point before the primaries; (2) has received endorsements from at least three prominent Republican figures or organizations; (3) has officially declared their candidacy and is actively campaigning. 

Trump being the nominee is determined by his selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, will Donald Trump face any legal challenges before November 5, 2024, that significantly impact his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election? 

Significant impact is defined as any legal action resulting in: 1) a formal indictment, 2) a conviction, 3) a court ruling restricting his ability to run for or hold office, or 4) a legal settlement imposing conditions affecting his candidacy. The legal challenges must be reported by at least two reputable news sources to confirm the nature and impact of the challenges.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A significant challenger emerge within the Republican Party before the 2024 primaries, (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) Donald Trump face legal challenges that impact his candidacy before the 2024 election?

This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) A significant challenger emerges within the Republican Party before February 1, 2024. If a candidate drops out after gaining significant traction, this will not affect the resolution if they were considered a significant challenger prior to their withdrawal.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(c) Donald Trump faces legal challenges that significantly impact his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election before November 5, 2024. Significant impact is defined as any legal action that results in: 1) a formal indictment, 2) a conviction, 3) a court ruling that restricts his ability to run for or hold office, or 4) a legal settlement that imposes conditions affecting his candidacy. The legal challenges must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to confirm the nature and impact of the challenges.

question.title: Given a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee, will the nominee be a former President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

Then is it true that the Republican nominee for President in 2024 will be a former President? This resolves as Yes if the nominee has previously served as President of the United States. The nomination must be confirmed by the Republican National Committee, and any ambiguity will be resolved based on reputable news sources.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is the 2024 Republican nominee, will Ivanka Trump seek political office by 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is confirmed as the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 by the Republican National Committee by November 5, 2024. This confirmation will be based on reputable news sources such as the New York Times, Washington Post, or Reuters, and in the event of a contested nomination process, the final decision made at the Republican National Convention will be used.

Then, is it true that Ivanka Trump will seek a political office by 2024? This question resolves as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Ivanka Trump has officially announced her candidacy for any political office in the United States. The announcement must be made through a reputable source such as a press release, social media statement from her official accounts, or coverage from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Any exploratory committees or informal statements will not count as a declaration of intent to seek office. The resolution will also consider any confirmed candidacy for the 2024 election cycle, regardless of the office level.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and (b) Ivanka Trump seek a political office by 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump is confirmed as the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 by the Republican National Committee by November 5, 2024. This will be based on reputable news sources such as the New York Times, Washington Post, or Reuters, and in the event of a contested nomination process, the final decision made at the Republican National Convention will be used. (2) Ivanka Trump officially announces her candidacy for any political office in the United States by December 31, 2024. This includes local, state, or federal positions and must be announced through a reputable source such as a press release, social media statement from her official accounts, or coverage from major news organizations like BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, or Washington Post. question.title: Given the Republican nominee is a Trump family member and former President, will Donald Trump run for President in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 is both a member of the Trump family and a former President. Specifically, the nominee must be one of the following individuals: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, and must have previously served as President of the United States. The nomination must be confirmed by the Republican National Committee, and any ambiguity regarding the status of the nominee will be resolved based on reputable news sources such as the New York Times, Washington Post, or Reuters. Then, will Donald Trump run for President again in 2024? This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Donald Trump has officially declared his candidacy for the 2024 Presidential election. An official declaration must be made through a public statement or announcement, and it must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If Trump is listed as a candidate on the ballot for the 2024 Presidential election, this will also count as a Yes, regardless of his prior announcements. Any informal statements or speculation about running do not count towards this resolution.

question.title: Given both a Trump family member is the Republican nominee and Ivanka Trump seeks office, will the Trump family endorse a non-family candidate?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. A member of the Trump family (such as Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, etc.) becomes the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024.
2. Ivanka Trump officially announces her candidacy for any political office in the United States by December 31, 2024, through a reputable source.

Given these conditions, will any member of the Trump family officially endorse a candidate for the 2024 election who is not a family member? The endorsement must be publicly announced through a credible medium and must be clear and unambiguous, indicating support for the non-family candidate in the context of the 2024 presidential election. The resolution will consider the first official endorsement made by any Trump family member.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) both of the following occur: (a) a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 (b) Ivanka Trump seek a political office by 2024, AND (2) the Trump family endorse a candidate other than a family member for the 2024 election?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(1) Both of the following conditions are met:
  (a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals:
     - Donald Trump
     - Donald Trump Jr.
     - Eric Trump
     - Ivanka Trump
     - Tiffany Trump
     - Melania Trump
     - Barron Trump

  (b) Ivanka Trump officially announces her candidacy for any political office in the United States by December 31, 2024. The announcement must be made through a reputable source such as a press release, social media statement from her official accounts, or coverage from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Exploratory committees or informal statements will not count. The resolution will consider any confirmed candidacy for the 2024 election cycle, regardless of the office level.

(2) Any member of the Trump family officially endorses a candidate for the 2024 election who is not a family member (i.e., not Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, or Donald Trump himself). The endorsement must be publicly announced through a credible medium such as a press release, a public event, or a verified social media account. The endorsement must be clear and unambiguous, indicating support for the non-family candidate in the context of the 2024 presidential election. Any informal statements or suggestions will not count towards this resolution. In case of conflicting endorsements, the first official endorsement will be considered.

question.title: Will a Trump family member hold a significant political position by 2025?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any member of the Trump family (including Donald Trump, Ivanka Trump, Eric Trump, Donald Trump Jr., or Tiffany Trump) holds a significant political position in the United States. A 'significant political position' is defined as any of the following: 1) Elected office at the federal level (e.g., U.S. Senator, U.S. Representative, or President). 2) Elected office at the state level (e.g., Governor, state legislator). 3) Appointed position in a federal or state government role (e.g., cabinet member, ambassador, or high-ranking official). The position must be confirmed by an official announcement or credible reporting from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Positions that are temporary, honorary, or purely ceremonial do not count towards this question's resolution.

question.title: Given both a Trump family member holds a significant political position by 2025 and Donald Trump runs for President in 2024, will a Trump family member be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) By December 31, 2025, a member of the Trump family holds a significant political position in the United States. This includes elected federal or state offices, or appointed federal or state government roles, confirmed by official announcements or credible reporting from at least two major news organizations. (b) By December 31, 2024, Donald Trump has officially declared his candidacy for the 2024 Presidential election, confirmed by a public statement and reporting by at least three reputable news organizations, or by being listed as a candidate on the ballot.

Then, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? Resolves Yes if one of the following individuals is the Republican nominee:

- Donald Trump
- Donald Trump Jr.
- Eric Trump
- Ivanka Trump
- Tiffany Trump
- Melania Trump
- Barron Trump

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) both of the following occur: (a) a Trump family member holds a significant political position by 2025 and (b) Donald Trump runs for President again in 2024, and (2) a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: 

(1) Both of the following occur: 
  (a) By December 31, 2025, any member of the Trump family (including Donald Trump, Ivanka Trump, Eric Trump, Donald Trump Jr., or Tiffany Trump) holds a significant political position in the United States. A 'significant political position' includes: 
    1) Elected office at the federal level (e.g., U.S. Senator, U.S. Representative, or President).
    2) Elected office at the state level (e.g., Governor, state legislator).
    3) Appointed position in a federal or state government role (e.g., cabinet member, ambassador, or high-ranking official). 
The position must be confirmed by an official announcement or credible reporting from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Positions that are temporary, honorary, or purely ceremonial do not count towards this question's resolution.
  (b) By December 31, 2024, Donald Trump has officially declared his candidacy for the 2024 Presidential election. An official declaration must be made through a public statement or announcement, and it must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If Trump is listed as a candidate on the ballot for the 2024 Presidential election, this will also count as a Yes, regardless of his prior announcements. Any informal statements or speculation about running do not count towards this resolution.

(2) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes the following individuals: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson receive the endorsement of any major Republican figures by 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson receives an official endorsement from any major Republican figure. A "major Republican figure" is defined as any current or former elected official at the federal, state, or local level, or any prominent Republican party leader, including but not limited to members of Congress, governors, or party chairs. The endorsement must be publicly announced through a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or through an official statement from the endorsing figure. In the absence of such an announcement, social media endorsements will not count unless they are accompanied by a formal statement or press release. The question will resolve as No if no such endorsement occurs by the deadline.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson receives the endorsement of any major Republican figures by 2024, will he be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson receives an official endorsement from any major Republican figure. A "major Republican figure" is defined as any current or former elected official at the federal, state, or local level, or any prominent Republican party leader, including but not limited to members of Congress, governors, or party chairs. The endorsement must be publicly announced through a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or through an official statement from the endorsing figure. In the absence of such an announcement, social media endorsements will not count unless they are accompanied by a formal statement or press release. Then, will Tucker Carlson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as Yes if he is selected as the nominee, and No if any other candidate is selected. The selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson is endorsed by major Republican figures and is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will a third-party candidate challenge him?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tucker Carlson receives an official endorsement from any major Republican figure and is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that by December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson has both received an endorsement from a major Republican figure (as defined by the criteria of the question) and is the Republican nominee.

Then, is it true that a third-party candidate will emerge to challenge the Republican nominee in the 2024 election? This question resolves as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a third-party candidate has officially declared their candidacy for the presidency of the United States and is actively campaigning against the Republican nominee, appearing on the ballot in at least 5 states and having received at least 5% of the popular vote in any major poll conducted after the official nomination of the Republican candidate. The declaration must be reported by at least three reputable news sources.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson receive a major Republican endorsement, become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will a third-party candidate emerge to challenge him?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following occur: (1) By December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson receives an official endorsement from any major Republican figure. A "major Republican figure" is defined as any current or former elected official at the federal, state, or local level, or any prominent Republican party leader, including but not limited to members of Congress, governors, or party chairs. The endorsement must be publicly announced through a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or through an official statement from the endorsing figure. In the absence of such an announcement, social media endorsements will not count unless they are accompanied by a formal statement or press release. (2) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (3) A third-party candidate has officially declared their candidacy for the presidency of the United States and is actively campaigning against the Republican nominee for the 2024 election. The candidate must be recognized as a legitimate third-party candidate, meaning they are not affiliated with the Republican Party and are running under a different party banner or as an independent. The candidate must also appear on the ballot in at least 5 states and have received at least 5% of the popular vote in any major poll conducted after the official nomination of the Republican candidate. The declaration of candidacy must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to be considered valid. All conditions must be met by the deadline for the question to resolve as Yes.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will he receive the endorsement of any major Republican figures by 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that the delegates of the Republican National Convention have chosen him as their candidate, regardless of who is listed or considered in the future.

Then, is it true that Tucker Carlson will receive an official endorsement from any major Republican figure by December 31, 2024? A "major Republican figure" includes current or former elected officials at the federal, state, or local level, or prominent Republican party leaders like members of Congress, governors, or party chairs. The endorsement must be publicly announced through a reputable news source or an official statement. Social media endorsements alone do not count unless accompanied by a formal statement or press release. The question resolves as Yes if such an endorsement occurs and No if it does not.

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee and endorsed by major figures, will his candidacy influence the Republican Party's platform?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and receives an endorsement from a major Republican figure by December 31, 2024. This means he is selected by the Republican National Convention and endorsed by a major figure as defined in the criteria.

Then, will Tucker Carlson's candidacy significantly influence the Republican Party's platform by 2024? This resolves as Yes if by December 31, 2024, his candidacy leads to significant changes in the Republican Party's platform, evidenced by official statements from the RNC or major leaders, adoption of at least three new policy proposals reflecting his viewpoints, and coverage by at least three reputable news sources confirming his influence. If his influence is significant but temporary, it resolves as No.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, receive the endorsement of any major Republican figures, and significantly influence the Republican Party's platform by 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) By December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson receives an official endorsement from any major Republican figure. A "major Republican figure" is defined as any current or former elected official at the federal, state, or local level, or any prominent Republican party leader, including but not limited to members of Congress, governors, or party chairs. The endorsement must be publicly announced through a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or through an official statement from the endorsing figure. Social media endorsements will not count unless accompanied by a formal statement or press release. (3) By December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson's candidacy has led to significant changes in the Republican Party's platform as evidenced by: a. Official statements from the Republican National Committee (RNC) or major Republican leaders indicating a shift in policy positions directly attributable to Carlson's influence. b. Adoption of at least three new policy proposals or amendments to the platform that reflect Carlson's viewpoints and are supported by a majority of party members during the 2024 Republican National Convention. c. Coverage and analysis from at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the influence of Carlson's candidacy on the party's platform. If all these conditions are not satisfied, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 1, 2024, Donald Trump is officially declared the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election by the Republican National Committee (RNC). The determination of the nominee will be based on the outcome of the Republican primaries and caucuses, culminating in the Republican National Convention. If Donald Trump secures the majority of delegates needed to win the nomination or is confirmed as the nominee by the RNC through a formal announcement, the question will resolve as Yes. Any credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming this outcome will also suffice as evidence.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Tucker Carlson receive the endorsement of any major Republican figures by 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential endorsement of Tucker Carlson by major Republican figures, contingent upon Donald Trump being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is officially declared the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election by the Republican National Committee (RNC) by July 1, 2024. This determination is based on the outcome of the Republican primaries and caucuses, culminating in the Republican National Convention. If Donald Trump secures the majority of delegates needed to win the nomination or is confirmed as the nominee by the RNC through a formal announcement, this condition is met. Any credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming this outcome will also suffice as evidence.

Then, is it true that Tucker Carlson will receive an official endorsement from any major Republican figure by December 31, 2024? A "major Republican figure" is defined as any current or former elected official at the federal, state, or local level, or any prominent Republican party leader, including but not limited to members of Congress, governors, or party chairs. The endorsement must be publicly announced through a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or through an official statement from the endorsing figure. In the absence of such an announcement, social media endorsements will not count unless they are accompanied by a formal statement or press release. If no such endorsement occurs by the deadline, the outcome is No.

question.title: Conditional on Trump being the Republican nominee and Tucker Carlson receiving major endorsements, will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question explores a scenario where both of the following conditions must be met: (1) By July 1, 2024, Donald Trump is officially declared the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election by the Republican National Committee (RNC). This can be through securing the majority of delegates or a formal announcement by the RNC, with confirmation from credible news sources. (2) By December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson receives an official endorsement from any major Republican figure, defined as current or former elected officials or prominent Republican leaders, with announcements through reputable news sources or official statements.

Given these conditions are true, the question then asks if Tucker Carlson will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of the final candidate on the election day. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and Tucker Carlson receive the endorsement of any major Republican figures by 2024, and (b) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 1, 2024, Donald Trump is officially declared the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election by the Republican National Committee (RNC). The determination of the nominee will be based on the outcome of the Republican primaries and caucuses, culminating in the Republican National Convention. If Donald Trump secures the majority of delegates needed to win the nomination or is confirmed as the nominee by the RNC through a formal announcement, the question will resolve as Yes. Any credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming this outcome will also suffice as evidence. (2) By December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson receives an official endorsement from any major Republican figure. A "major Republican figure" is defined as any current or former elected official at the federal, state, or local level, or any prominent Republican party leader, including but not limited to members of Congress, governors, or party chairs. The endorsement must be publicly announced through a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or through an official statement from the endorsing figure. In the absence of such an announcement, social media endorsements will not count unless they are accompanied by a formal statement or press release. (3) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. The question will resolve as No if any of these conditions are not met by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Tucker Carlson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will there have been a major scandal affecting his chances before 2024?
question.body:
This question examines whether, before January 1, 2024, a major scandal involving Tucker Carlson will have been reported by at least three reputable news sources (such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) that significantly impacts his public image and political viability as a candidate for the Republican nomination. A 'major scandal' is defined as any incident that leads to widespread media coverage, public backlash, or significant political consequences, such as loss of endorsements or support from key Republican figures. The scandal must be of such magnitude that it is likely to affect his chances of being nominated, as assessed by political analysts or major media outlets.

Criterion for condition: Tucker Carlson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as No.

If Tucker Carlson is not the nominee, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Tucker Carlson being the Republican nominee and facing a major scandal, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question examines the scenario where both of the following occur: 

1. Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Before January 1, 2024, a major scandal involving Tucker Carlson is reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) that significantly impacts his public image and political viability as a candidate for the Republican nomination. The scandal must lead to widespread media coverage, public backlash, or significant political consequences, such as loss of endorsements or support from key Republican figures, and be of such magnitude that it is likely to affect his chances of being nominated, as assessed by political analysts or major media outlets.

Given these conditions, the question resolves YES if, by July 1, 2024, Donald Trump is officially declared the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election by the Republican National Committee (RNC). The determination of the nominee will be based on the outcome of the Republican primaries and caucuses, culminating in the Republican National Convention. If Donald Trump secures the majority of delegates needed to win the nomination or is confirmed as the nominee by the RNC through a formal announcement, the question will resolve as YES. Any credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming this outcome will also suffice as evidence. If the initial conditions are not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) A major scandal will affect Tucker Carlson's chances of being the Republican nominee before 2024 (2) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur:

1. Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, AND before January 1, 2024, a major scandal involving Tucker Carlson is reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) that significantly impacts his public image and political viability as a candidate for the Republican nomination. The scandal must lead to widespread media coverage, public backlash, or significant political consequences, such as loss of endorsements or support from key Republican figures, and be of such magnitude that it is likely to affect his chances of being nominated, as assessed by political analysts or major media outlets.

2. By July 1, 2024, Donald Trump is officially declared the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election by the Republican National Committee (RNC). The determination of the nominee will be based on the outcome of the Republican primaries and caucuses, culminating in the Republican National Convention. If Donald Trump secures the majority of delegates needed to win the nomination or is confirmed as the nominee by the RNC through a formal announcement, the question will resolve as Yes. Any credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming this outcome will also suffice as evidence.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.
